definition: to warn/to alert/to be on the alert/to stand guard/sentinel
to guard against/to exhort/to admonish or warn/to give up or stop doing sth/Buddhist monastic discipline/ring (for a finger)

sentences.english: The deposit insurance fund fell into the red in 2009.
sentences.chinese: 存款保險資金在2009年進入紅色警戒區。

sentences.english: The US-led NATO forces have cordoned off the scene of the incident, witnesses said.
sentences.chinese: 目擊者說北約軍隊在事故現場在實施了警戒。

sentences.english: In communicating the level of alarm, authorities need to be able to move down as well as up.
sentences.chinese: 在通報警戒級別時，各方當局需能做出上下調整。

sentences.english: Chinese Education Department also made an urgent announcement, appeal people to raise alertness.
sentences.chinese: 中國教育部週四也發出緊急通知，呼籲提高警戒。

sentences.english: Preventing and detecting adverse effects from medicines is termed pharmacovigilance.
sentences.chinese: 預防和發現藥物副作用被稱爲藥物警戒。

sentences.english: She predicts the World Health Organization will soon raise the alert level to phase six, an official pandemic.
sentences.chinese: 她預測世衛組織很快會將警戒級別調至6級。

sentences.english: The demand for circumcision seems to have caught everybody off guard.
sentences.chinese: 割包皮的要求似乎將每個人都拽回了警戒線內。

sentences.english: A family setting is whenpeople often let their guard down, which can lead to ugly confrontations.
sentences.chinese: 在家庭環境中，人們往往放鬆警戒而導致醜陋的對峙。

sentences.english: The yellow and red line on the chart above represents the alert thresholds.
sentences.chinese: 圖中，黃色和紅色的線條表示警戒閾值。

sentences.english: Scientists call these bright colors warning colours.
sentences.chinese: 科學家們稱這些明亮的顏色爲“警戒色”。

sentences.english: But the global financial crisis has strengthened the case for caution in the minds of party leaders.
sentences.chinese: 但是全球金融危機已經加強了黨領導警戒意識。

sentences.english: The night watchmen who apprehended the thief was praised for his vigilance.
sentences.chinese: 抓到小偷的那位夜班警衛因他的警戒而受到表揚。

sentences.english: Holding crossbows and arrows and other long-distance shooting weapons, they took up the job of defending the whole battle formation.
sentences.chinese: 他們手執弓弩等遠射兵器，擔任整個軍陣的警戒任務。

sentences.english: Setting data-driven OOT alert limits in such situations may not be possible.
sentences.chinese: 在這種情況下，不可能設置數據驅動的OOT警戒線。

sentences.english: In old age, he should abstain from acquisitiveness.
sentences.chinese: 年老時血氣衰弱，要警戒，不可貪得無厭。

definition: to monitor/to keep a close watch over/surveillance
to investigate a crime/to scout/to reconnoiter/reconnaissance/detection/a scout
to be on call/to be on standby
to keep watch/to do sentry duty/to be on patrol
